Key Match Events: South Africa won by 4 wickets with 7 balls remaining.
Pre-Game Insights: South Africa up against their bogey team in batter-unfriendly New York.
Netherlands tripped up South Africa in the previous two men's World Cups.
Morkel: South Africa cannot expect to roll Netherlands over.
Klaasen on New York pitch: Batters need to suck it up.
Nortje: Don't need 20 sixes to make an entertaining game.
The Dutch beat South Africa at the 2022 tournament and ended their semi-final hopes.
Netherlands beat South Africa again at the 2023 ODI World Cup, exposing South Africa's vulnerability in the chase.
South Africa reduced Sri Lanka to their lowest T20I total and chased it down in straightforward fashion.
South Africa's middle-order, including Aiden Markram, Tristan Stubbs, Heinrich Klaasen, and David Miller, is considered stable.
Klaasen said they are prepared to use their 'cricket brains' and play 'smarter cricket'.
Conditions could favor Netherlands' conservative batting approach.
Netherlands' bowlers were exemplary in Dallas and will look to build on that performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Heinrich Klaasen: 'We definitely want to get back a couple of games against Netherlands. They just do the basics extremely well.'
Scott Edwards: 'For us it's about adapting to whatever the wicket brings to us.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The weather is set fine, with highs in the mid-20s.
Netherlands have beaten South Africa in their previous two World Cup meetings but have not won any matches against them outside of those two.
Ottneil Baartman is the leading South African wicket-taker in T20s this year with 34 wickets at an average of 15.17.
Max O'Dowd has the highest career strike rate in the Dutch squad at 121.13.
Five South Africans have higher strike rates than Max O'Dowd.
